Package io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.box

package io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.box
Provides predefined box styles for rendering framed content in the terminal.

This package contains the BoxStyle record, which defines the visual appearance of boxes using Unicode or ASCII characters. Each style specifies corner characters, horizontal and vertical lines, and junction characters for separators. These styles are used by console rendering components to display structured output such as prompts, messages, or tables.

Available Styles:

  • ASCII – simple plus, minus, and pipe characters
  • UNICODE – single-line Unicode box drawing characters
  • DOUBLE – double-line Unicode box drawing characters
  • ROUNDED – rounded corners with Unicode
  • HEAVY – bold, heavy lines
  • BLOCK – solid block characters
  • MINIMAL – whitespace and vertical bars only

Key Components:

  • BoxStyle – record defining box styles

Usage Example:

BoxStyle style = BoxStyle.DOUBLE;
System.out.println(style.topLeft() + style.horizontal().repeat(20) + style.topRight());
Since:
0.1.0
  • Record Classes
    Class
    Description
    BoxStyle
    Represents a visual box style using Unicode or ASCII characters.
